text: Mohammed Refaat El-Saeed ( Muhammad Rifaʻatu s-Saʻīd, 11 October 1932 ­– 17 August 2017) was an Egyptian politician, scholar and writer. He served as the general secretary of the National Progressive Unionist Party (Tagammu).Al- Ahram. The organiser Africa research bulletin: Political, social, and cultural series, Vol. 32. Blackwell, 1995. p. 1879 El-Saeed held two doctorates in history, and was a part-time lecturer at the American University in Cairo. El- Saeed was a frequent contributor to al-Ahali, the Tagammu party organ. El- Saeed died on 17 August 2017 at the age of 84.اليوم السابع. وفاة الدكتور رفعت السعيد الرئيس السابق لحزب التجمع ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Egyptian politicians Category:Egyptian scientists Category:Egyptian writers
title: Mohamed Refaat El-Saeed
